sectionText: Environmental Education Field Experience will introduce students to the thinking process required for developing high quality environmental education activities and provide practice designing and implementing them. The course will begin with classroom instruction and activities for the first few weeks of the semester. The field experience for this course will take two forms, leading an Environmental Science after school club at Booker T. Washington Elementary School  once a week for eight weeks (February-April) and delivering an environmental education activity on Friday and Saturday of ExploreACES (March 10 and 11). There is no fee for this section of NRES 285. If all seats are full, complete the form at http://go.illinois.edu/NRESwaitinglist to be added to the waiting list.
sectionNotes: Restricted to Natural Resrcs & Environ Sci major(s). Restricted to students with Sophomore, Junior, or Senior class standing.
